[A little behind this region the outer capsule 
becomes very thin (Figs 5 & 6) from the loss of 
fibres from their having entered the inner capsule 
as just described. At the part where this attenuation 
occurs these fibres of the outer capsule <s>I believe <\s>
derived from the crossed callosal tract, I believe enter 
& form one of the chief roots of origin of the olfactory <s>tract (see Fig 5) tract <\s>
tract <s>tract <\s>. The manner in wh: this is accomplished 
is shown in figure 5, and I shall reserve further 
details for the present.
[Still more posteriorly the fibres entering the outer 
capsule from the <u>crossed callosal tract <\u> run almost 
perpendicularly downwards 
Continue
